Detailed Description

template<typename T, class TRAITS, class ALLOCATOR>
class cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T *, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >

TZCyclicQueue specialization for pointer.

Note
This is a specialization of TZCyclicQueue for pointer type. The specialization can manage at least two-byte aligned data: the least significant bit (LSB) of any pointer stored in the queue must be zero since the algorithm may use LSB as a flag that marks the free cell.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<typename T , class TRAITS , class ALLOCATOR >
cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T *, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >::TZCyclicQueue ( unsigned int  nPow2 = 20 ) [inline]

Constructs queue.

The capacity of cyclic array is 2**nPow2, nPow2 <= 31.

Note, the capacity of queue is 2**nPow2 - 2.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T , class TRAITS , class ALLOCATOR >
size_t cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T *, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >::capacity (  ) const [inline]

Return capacity of the queue.

The queue's capacity is not real size of array allocated for the items. For TZCyclicQueue it is N - 1, where N - max queue size passed in construction time

template<typename T , class TRAITS , class ALLOCATOR >
bool cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T *, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >::dequeue ( T *&  dest ) [inline]

Dequeues item from the queue.

Popped item is placed to data.

Returns true if success, false otherwise (for example, if queue is empty )

template<typename T , class TRAITS , class ALLOCATOR >
bool cds::queue::TZCyclicQueue< T *, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >::enqueue ( T *  pNewNode ) [inline]

Enqueues item from the queue.

Returns true if success, false otherwise (for example, if queue is full)
